Authors:
Yang Wang, Yong-Lan Tuo, Dong-Mei Wu, Neng Gao, Zhen-Hao
Zhang, Gu Rao, Xiao-Min Wang, Jing Wang, Dan Dai, Yu Li, Bo Zhang
Title:
Four novel boletoid fungi (Boletaceae, Boletales) from East
Asia
Abstract:
Boletaceae, one of the ectomycorrhizal fungi in the
forest, plays an essential role ecologically. Although it possesses a
relatively comprehensive history of work globally, novel species and
genera are continually described. During the investigation of Northern
China, many specimens of boletoid fungi were collected. Based on the
study of morphology and phylogeny, four new species, Butyriboletus
pseudoroseoflavus, Butyriboletus subregius, Tengioboletus subglutinosus,
and Suillellus lacrybasidius, are introduced. Morphological evidence and
phylogenetic analyses of the single or combined dataset (ITS or 28S,
rpb1, rpb2, and tef1) confirmed these to be four new species. They
indicated their relationships with other species within their genus.
Detailed descriptions, color photographs, and line drawings are
provided. The species of Butyriboletus in China were compared in detail,
the worldwide keys of Tengioboletus and Suillellus were given.
